intro: Bulbophyllum condylochilum, commonly known as the condylochilum orchid, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is a terrestrial orchid with a distinctive appearance, featuring a pseudobulb and linear leaves. The plant produces striking, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often with a contrasting purple lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated by orchid enthusiasts worldwide.
